channel.title: Need faster Processor
channel.description:
Being using my currently pc for 7 month and it is start to feel very slow for multitasker for me. (Especially when I have browser on with game running at same time) [img]https://sphotos-f.ak.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ak-ash4/252250_3819255851612_1768288904_n.jpg[/img]
Any good i5 that can let me multitask without too much slowing down?
I am not too good with these PC stuff. :\

item.title: Need faster Processor
item.dc:creator: sudpuzzer
item.description:
A little late, but I definitely recommend an SSD. I’m running an i5-750 @ 2.6 Ghz, and I invested in an SSD and there was a noticeable increase in performance and overall ‘snappiness’ of my system. That, and the RAM/64Bit upgrade is what I would have suggested.

Read full topic

item.title: Need faster Processor
item.dc:creator: Eric_Fong
item.description:
Okay, reformat and 64bits is now working. Had some BootMGR error but fixed through DIOS setting.

Thanks everyone who helped.

Read full topic

item.title: Need faster Processor
item.dc:creator: Chickenprotector
item.description:
Eric Fong:

Thing is, my keybroad isn’t working until the password entering screen shows up

If your desktop’s a public machine, I understand. If not (and you don’t have family who decide to use your machine), why in god’s green earth do you have a password for the startup…

No matter. Repeatedly mash F5 after you type in the password then.

Read full topic

item.title: Need faster Processor
item.dc:creator: Blank
item.description:
Eric Fong:

So yeah, I plug in my ram and my pc detected it correctly. But not the harddisk

You have to format it. Go to Control panel > System and Security >Administrative tools > Computer management. You should now see your new hard drive, so you right click on it, choose to format it. You should now be good to go, gl hf.

Read full topic

item.title: Need faster Processor
item.dc:creator: Blank
item.description:
Maxey:

Jeez man, you’re really green at the computers.

He did state that quite clearly in the beginning of the thread. Anyslut, DDR3 is a RAM standard that provides faster speeds compared to previous ones such as DDR2. The faster, the better basically.

Read full topic

item.title: Need faster Processor
item.dc:creator: Chickenprotector
item.description:
… there’s different types of memory for different types of mother boards. I.E. DDR 1/2/3 it’s a technical aspect, I don’t quite understand what it’s abbreviated for anyway. But when they ask for the type of RAM, you want DDR 3.

By the way: SSD = Solid State (hard)Drive. It pulls data about 10 times as quickly as a normal HDD, but they’re expensive.

Read full topic

item.title: Need faster Processor
item.dc:creator: Eric_Fong
item.description:
Chickenprotector:

^ For the brand of HDD, I can’t say. Whatever is reliable, I would suggest getting something that has a USB cable or is a seta drive. If you have cash to burn, spend a few hundred on a SSD for your main boot disc.

Also, I forgot to mention you NEED DDR3 memory for your Mobo, it won’t recognize anything else. And when you go get memory, don’t worry about brand. They’re all the same, prices are just different, go with the cheapest one.

If you want to run things on max settings and still have some physical memory to spare, you want at least 8 gigs.

DDR3 memory, what’s that??

Read full topic

item.title: Need faster Processor
item.dc:creator: Chickenprotector
item.description:
^ For the brand of HDD, I can’t say. Whatever is reliable, I would suggest getting something that has a USB cable or is a seta drive. If you have cash to burn, spend a few hundred on a SSD for your main boot disc.

Also, I forgot to mention you NEED DDR3 memory for your Mobo, it won’t recognize anything else. And when you go get memory, don’t worry about brand. They’re all the same, prices are just different, go with the cheapest one.

Pyro:

I thought that 4 gigs of RAM was more than enough for most things.

If you want to run things on max settings and still have some physical memory to spare, you want at least 8 gigs.

Read full topic

item.title: Need faster Processor
item.dc:creator: Chickenprotector
item.description:
^ You only need about 8-16 gig of ram… don’t go anymore than that. 32 gig isn’t worth it unless you’re running a virtual computer or computers.

To make it easier on you, just pull your saved games, docs, and the obvious bullshit. Avoid your browser cashes, those are the most likely places where the viruses/spyware, etc. will hide. Just about all the advice I can give on that.

Read full topic
